host_templates._comment:
{FR: Modèle pour superviser les serveurs ESX VMWare via le connecteur centreon-vmware}
{EN: Template to check VMWare ESX Server using centreon-vmware connector}
host_templates.alias: Template to check VMWare ESX Server using centreon-vmware connector
host_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX

information.author: Centreon

description.value:
**Plugin pack to monitor VMware ESX/ESXi server via VMware Perl SDK.**

Available host templates and related services:

|Virt-VMWare2-ESX|
|---|
|ESX-Vm-Count|
|ESX-Cpu|
|ESX-Memory|
|ESX-Swap|
|ESX-Health|
|ESX-Status|

Other service templates available:

* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Alarms-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Datastores-Latency-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Maintenance-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Service-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Storage-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Time-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Traffic-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Uptime-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Io-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Iops-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Snapshots-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Usage-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Vm-Count-Generic

Available service discovery rules:

* Virt-VMWare2-Esx-Datastores-Latency-Name 
* Virt-VMWare2-Esx-Nics-Traffic-Name 

This pack provides a host discovery rule.

(Compatibility with Cenreon VMware Connector version >= 3)

**Plugin pack pour superviser les serveurs VMware ESX/ESXi via VMware Perl SDK.**

Modèles d\'hôte disponibles et leurs services :

|Virt-VMWare2-ESX|
|---|
|ESX-Vm-Count|
|ESX-Cpu|
|ESX-Memory|
|ESX-Swap|
|ESX-Health|
|ESX-Status|

Autre modèles de service disponible :

* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Alarms-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Datastores-Latency-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Maintenance-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Service-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Storage-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Time-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Traffic-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Uptime-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Io-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Iops-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Snapshots-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Usage-Generic
* Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Vm-Count-Generic

Règles de découverte de services disponibles :

* Virt-VMWare2-Esx-Datastores-Latency-Name 
* Virt-VMWare2-Esx-Nics-Traffic-Name 

Ce pack fournit une règle de découverte d\'hôte.

(Compatibilité avec la version du Connecteur VMware >= 3)

information.monitoring_procedure:
# Monitoring procedure ## Prerequisites This chapter describes the prerequisites installation needed by plugins to run. ### Centreon Plugin Install this plugin on each needed poller: # yum install centreon-plugin-Virtualization-Vmware2-Connector-Plugin ### Installation of the VMware daemon Install this daemon on each needed poller: # yum install centreon-plugin-Virtualization-VMWare-daemon ### Configuration of the VMware daemon The daemon "centreon-vmware" has a configuration file "/etc/centreon/centreon\_vmware.pm" of the following structure: %centreon_vmware_config = vsphere_server => { 'default' => {'url' => 'https://vcenter/sdk', 'username' => 'XXXXXXX', 'password' => 'XXXXXX'} }, port => 5700 }; Then start daemon with command: # service centreon_vmware start You can configure multiple vCenter / vSphere / ESX connections using this structure: %centreon_vmware_config = ( vsphere_server => { 'default' => {'url' => 'https://vcenter/sdk', 'username' => 'XXXXXXX', 'password' => 'XXXXXX'}, 'other' => {'url' => 'https://other_vcenter/sdk', 'username' => 'XXXXXXX', 'password' => 'XXXXXX'}, }, port => 5700 ); 1; Notice: use "CENTREONVMWARECONTAINER" host macro definition to select your configuration. * The "vsphere\_server" attribute allows you to configure access to different VirtualCenter. It is necessary to have at least the entry 'default'. So, if you have only one vcenter, you can configure it with the name "default". * The "url" attribute allows you to configure the URL of the vcenter. * The "username" attribute allows you to configure the user who can connect to the vcenter. This user must have at least "read only" access to the vcenter. * The "password" attribute allows you to configure the password of the user. * The "port" attribute allows you to configure the listening port of "centreon-vmware" connector. ### System configuration The daemon "centreon_vmware" is a system service that must be started by default. After installation and configuration, you will have to perform the following procedure. #### With SysV (Enterprise Linux 6 compatible distributions) chkconfig centreon_vmware on service centreon_vmware start #### With SystemD (Enterprise Linux 7 compatible distributions) systemctl enable centreon_vmware systemctl start centreon_vmware #### Checking the daemon configuration Please make sure that the daemon configuration works fine, by looking for errors in /var/log/centreon/centreon_vmware.log. ## Centreon configuration ### Create a host using the appropriate template Go to *Configuration > Hosts* and click *Add*. Then, fill the form as shown by the following table:
Field value

Host name

Name of the host

Alias

Host description

IP

Host IP Address

Monitored from

Monitoring Poller to use

Host Multiple Templates

Virt-VMWare2-ESX-custom
Click the *Save* button. ### Host macro configuration The following macros must be configured on host:
Macro Description Default value Example

CENTREONVMWAREPORT

Port of Centreon-Vmware daemon

5700

570

CENTREONVMWARECONTAINER

Container to use

default

default

CENTREONVMWAREHOST

Host of Centreon-Vmware daemon

localhost

localhost

ESXNAME

Name of the ESX to monitor

srvi-esx
information.name: VMware ESX

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier le nombre de machines virtuelles allumées/éteintes/suspendues sur un serveur ESX.}{EN: Check virtual machines running/off/suspended on an ESX Server.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Vm-Count-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier si une machine virtuelle swappe sur le serveur ESX.}{EN: Check if a virtual machine is swapping on the ESX server.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Swap-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier l'état global d'un serveur ESX.}{EN: Check global status of an ESX Server.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Status-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier le taux d'utilisation mémoire d'un serveur ESX.}{EN: Check Memory usage of an ESX Server.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Memory-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier les sondes matériels et processeurs d'un serveur ESX.}{EN: Check hardware and CPU sensors of an ESX Server.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Health-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier le taux d'utilisation CPU d'un serveur ESX.}{EN: Check CPU usage of an ESX Server.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Cpu-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier les alarmes d'un ESX.}{EN: Check alarms of an ESX host (red an yellow)..}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Alarms-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier le taux d'utilisation des interfaces réseaux physiques d'un serveur ESX. Les seuils sont en pourcent.}{EN: Check traffic usages of a physical network interfaces. Thresholds are in percent.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Traffic-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier la latence rencontré par le serveur ESX sur ses datastores.}{EN: Check Datastores latency of an ESX Server.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Datastores-Latency-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier le mode de maintenance d'un serveur ESX.}{EN: Check maintenance mode of an ESX Server.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Maintenance-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de récuperer l'uptime en jours d'un serveur ESX.}{EN: Get uptime in days of an ESX Server.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Uptime-Generic

service_templates._comment:
{FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier l'état des services d'un serveur ESX.}
{EN: Check services of an ESX Server.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Service-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier le taux d'utilisation d'un datastore.}{EN: Check datastore usage.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Usage-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier le taux d'utilisation en Kbps d'un datastore.}{EN: Check datastore usage in Kbps.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Io-Generic

service_templates._comment:
{FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier le décalage de temps d'un serveur ESX.}
{EN: Check time of an ESX Server.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Time-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier le taux d'utilisation des snapshots sur un datastore.}{EN: Check snapshots usage on a datastore.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Snapshots-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier les IOPs moyens d'un datastore.}{EN: Check average IOPs of a datastore.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Iops-Generic

service_templates._comment: {FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier le nombre de machines virtuelles allumées/éteintes/suspendues sur un datastore.}{EN: Check virtual machines running/off/suspended on a datastore.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-Datastore-Vm-Count-Generic

service_templates._comment:
{FR: Contrôle permettant de vérifier les informations de stockage.}
{EN: Check ESX storage informations.}
service_templates.name: Virt-VMWare2-ESX-Storage-Generic
